title: 112_hr254
content: The "Sewage Sludge in Food Production Consumer Notification Act" requires notification to consumers of food products produced on land where sewage sludge has been applied. The Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act is amended to require labeling of food produced on land where sewage sludge was applied, effective one year after the enactment of the Sewage Sludge in Food Production Consumer Notification Act. The Sewage Sludge in Food Production Consumer Notification Act amends the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to require labeling of food produced on land where sewage sludge was applied. The term 'sewage sludge' is defined in section 503.9(w) of title 40, Code of Federal Regulations. The Sewage Sludge in Food Production Consumer Notification Act requires labeling of food derived from poultry raised on land where sewage sludge was applied, effective one year after enactment. Exceptions include if sewage sludge application ceased over a year before poultry raising or if the product is labeled accordingly. The Sewage Sludge in Food Production Consumer Notification Act mandates labeling of poultry raised on land where sewage sludge was applied. The Act defines "sewage sludge" and amends the Federal Meat Inspection Act to include this requirement. The Sewage Sludge in Food Production Consumer Notification Act requires labeling of livestock products derived from animals that grazed on land where sewage sludge was applied, effective one year after enactment. The Sewage Sludge in Food Production Consumer Notification Act mandates labeling for livestock products from animals that grazed on or consumed feed from land treated with sewage sludge. The term "sewage sludge" is defined in accordance with the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act. The Poultry Products Inspection Act is amended to include regulations regarding sewage sludge in food production. Livestock products derived from poultry raised on land treated with sewage sludge must be labeled accordingly. The Poultry Products Inspection Act requires labeling for poultry products raised on land treated with sewage sludge, either through direct application or consumption of feed produced on such land. The Poultry Products Inspection Act mandates labeling for poultry raised on land treated with sewage sludge, in accordance with the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act. This does not affect the prohibition on sewage sludge use in the National Organic Program. Regulations on the use of sewage sludge, including ash, grit, or screenings, in organic food production under the National Organic Program of the Department of Agriculture. The term "sewage sludge" is defined as per section 503.9(w) of title 40, Code of Federal Regulations, including ash from sewage sludge incineration and grit/screenings from sewage treatment works.
